```html Management of Premenstrual Syndrome

Variables

  • Diagnosis of PMS
  • Severity of Symptoms
  • Previous Treatments
  • Medical History
  • Patient Preferences

Guidance

Initial Assessment: Use a symptom diary for two cycles to record symptoms.

Diagnostic Confirmation: Consider GnRH analogues for 3 months if the symptom diary is inconclusive.

Referral: Refer to a gynaecologist if simple measures fail and severity justifies.

Management: Use an integrated holistic approach, considering Drospirenone-containing COCs as a first-line pharmaceutical intervention. CBT and SSRIs should also be considered for severe cases.

Severe PMS Treatment: GnRH analogues + add-back therapy or surgical options may be considered if medical management fails.

```
